lines.text: One of these days all these girls are going to show up at the same time and you are going to get shot.
Oh but what a cuckoo firing squad.
You're emotionally upset, have a glass of water.
I don't want a glass of water, I want a divorce!
Why don't you settle down and get married, find a nice girl.
I did; but, you married her.
Oh, she just picked the better man.
Yeah and you ought to be ashamed of yourself, eloping with an 18-year old kid and here I am in the twilight of my life, approaching middle age, a lonely bachelor. And what have I got?
Only the best collection of dames in the town.
Now, this
[black negligee]
just came in, direct from Paris and it looks like you. It's called Viva la Derriere. Trust me. It will be perfect for what you want.
Wow! It better do what I want. It costs more than a washing machine.
Now, listen, this will do things a washing machine never even thought of.
Oh, sit down, Ernie, I'm not trying to make a pass at you. I'm merely trying to find out if anything's wrong with me.

There's nothing wrong with you, Val, you're just as attractive today as you were the day I met you. In fact, I think you're much better looking now than you were then. And if I'm right, you were quite skinny.
I wasn't skinny, I was 18. There's a difference.
Now, let me see, an application. The position is secretary. Oh, here it is. Well, it says here your first name is Kitty.
Uh-huh, with two t's.
Mr. Turner, if your cars are built half as good as those girls, you're home free.
Now, I get the picture. Dan is pre-occupied with his work. He feels sure of you. You feel neglected. You're getting a little older.
A lot older! I told you, I'm a realist.
And, you're starting to feel insecure. Now, what do we do about it?
We stop playing analyst and we sit down and draw up the divorce papers. Everybodies getting a divorce. I'll be one of the IN people.
The basis for an annulment is the non-consummation of a marriage.
Well, that's obvious. I only love Dan. I merely substituted Ernie for your black negligee.
Mr. Brewer, our quota is 30 letters a day. We must make our quota.
I know what we'll do Miss Blight. Why don't you write them and I'll just sign them.
Oh, now, it won't take too long. My shorthand is 150 and my typing is 100.
And Lola was 38-22-36.
I beg pardon?
I'm just dreaming. Just dreaming!
